author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Btw something that BCH might consider: https://medium.com/@m.vanderwijden1/faster-block-propagation-in-blockchain-networks-2ad0ab3097a3
It's not really useful in ethereum since blocks are small, but might make sense with the big blocks of BCH.
It can significantly reduce the time needed to propagate a block, while still being resilient against DDOS attacks

author: mtrycz
content: I'll definitely have an in-depth read, and point it out to others

author: mtrycz
content: It makes a lot of sense to have blocks forwarded soon by trusted peers

author: mtrycz
content: BCHN people are noting that BCHN has inherited the CompactBlocks scheme from Core via ABC (https://bitcoincore.org/en/2016/06/07/compact-blocks-faq/), which does a version of what you describe.

author: mtrycz
content:
To the best of my understanding, only BitcoinUnlimited implements it correctly, as BCHN (and Core) cannot forward missing transactions until it is done processingg the block, by virtue of the network being singlethreaded, making the scheme moot (unless the mempools are already in sync, which is a hard assumption). 
This singlethreadedness is what I wish to tackle in the coming months.
